name: n,n'-dimethylacetamide
Reason: 1,1-Dimethylacetamide has a melting point of around -10 degrees Celsius. The basic unit for comparison is acetamide, which has a melting point of -10 degrees Celsius. The additional functional groups and structural features in n,n'-dimethylacetamide will affect its melting point: (1) Two methyl groups, which can each add approximately +10 due to the increase in molecular weight and rigidity of the structure; (2) The nitrogen atom (N) introduces a rigid structure, which can participate in hydrogen bonding, raising the melting point by approximately +5 degrees Celsius.
